conclusion: The problem involves an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process A→B→B→C→A.
The axes are pressure (p) in 10⁵ Pa (vertical) and volume (V) in L (horizontal).
The temperature at state A is 200K.
We need to find work done by the external environment on the gas during C→A.
Process C→A appears to be an isobaric (constant pressure) process since the pressure remains at 1×10⁵ Pa while the volume decreases from 5L to 2L.
For an isobaric process, work done by the gas is W = P × (Vfinal - Vinitial).
For work done by the external environment on the gas, W_external = P × (Vinitial - Vfinal).
For the C→A process, W_external = 1×10⁵ Pa × (5×10⁻³ m³ - 2×10⁻³ m³) = 300 J.
Verification using the ideal gas law, PV = nRT.
For an isobaric process, V₁/T₁ = V₂/T₂, or T₂ = T₁ × (V₂/V₁).
The temperature at state C would be T_C = 200K / 0.4 = 500K.
This is consistent with our calculation of the work.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A is 300 J.
